name: Aarhus
fun_fact: Fun fact: Denmark's second-largest city is home to the iconic ARoS Rainbow Panorama - a 150-meter circular walkway that lets you see the city through every color of the rainbow, inspired by Dante's Divine Comedy!

hero_dishes.name: New Nordic Cuisine
hero_dishes.description: Aarhus has developed its own New Nordic food scene beyond Copenhagen's fame, with three Michelin-starred restaurants and hyperlocal ingredients from the Bay of Aarhus including jellyfish, lobster, and pungent seaweed.
hero_dishes.origin_story: The culinary scene developed its own identity thanks to the unique treats found in the waters of the Bay of Aarhus, providing ingredients that epitomize the farm-to-table ethos of New Nordic cuisine.

hero_dishes.name: Organic Nordic Plates
hero_dishes.description: Artistic and seasonal plates featuring local ingredients like cod with pumpkin, fennel and blackberry, or local mussels with potato, spinach and apple.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Aarhus chefs embrace the changing seasons, with menus that reflect the Nordic landscape and the Danish countryside's rhythms.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: L'Estragon (organic restaurant), Restaurant MellemRum (elegant Nordic with vegetarian options), Aarhus Central Food Market at Skt Knuds Torv

signature_drinks.name: Local Craft Beer
signature_drinks.description: Aarhus has a thriving craft beer scene with cozy bars throughout the city.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Enjoyed in the city's many cozy bars and cafes, often paired with New Nordic small plates or traditional Danish open-faced sandwiches (sm√∏rrebr√∏d).
